sentence: The website has all what you need, but they need to work on filtering fake reviews.
Very slow when processing orders, I know you are a big company but make it faster so I can be a happier customers!!!!!

I'm a seller. Amazon gives refunds to buyers without a return. All any buyer has to do is say they are dissatisfied, call Scamazon, say they want a refund. Bam, the buyer gets a refund and the product. There are better sales channels out there, look for emerging sales channels. This site NEVER, EVER decides in favor of the seller.
Great products, Delivered on time

Tried to buy new alarm clock. Had to enter e-mail and password. Entered password. Then it asked for password and captcha. Sent e-mail I had to confirm all just to log in. Finally logged in. Tried to check out. Wanted password. Entered password. Then it asked for password and captcha again, even though I had already gone through that just to log in. Would not let me check out. Called customer service. First person transferred me to second person. Had to give all the information again. He transferred me to a third person. "Your account has been locked out because it has been so long. We'll have to connect you to our security..." That's when I hung up. NOT WORTH IT!!! I'll never use Amazon again!
Really good value for money, not just free next day delivery but all the prime features.

Sometimes not the cheapest but Amazon never fails to have excellent products at excellent prices.  I love the fact that when you buy directly from them and the product is not to your satisfaction you can send it back for free.  I made the mistake of buying Dr. Marten boots from ebay instead of Amazon and because they were too big had to pay a whopping ¬£7.50 to return them.  I was gutted and vowed never to buy shoes from ebay again!  Amazon all the way!
Always great customer service

I purchased a Nespresso machine from Amazon. The machine was faulty.Amazon replaced it for new one . After arranging 2 times to have the old one collected no one came to pick up the old machine. After calling Amazon they agreed I could keep the old machine . But to then a couple of weeks later to take payments for new machine . Leaving me with fees to pay because my account didn't have enough to money to pay some bills.They gave me ¬£10 credit to use for Amazon a purchase.But doesn't help with my fees outstanding on my bank account. I'm not happy.

Since 2006, we have placed almost a hundred orders with Amazon.com.  To the best of my memory, we have never had to contact customer service, and we have never had any bad experiences with Amazon or with anyone who was selling on Amazon.  They seem to be a very well run company.  I realize that not everyone will have such good luck, but their overall record is probably very good.      For $90 a year we get amazon prime, which means we get free two day shipping on most items that are ordered directly from Amazon.  Since we get the free shipping, it is very difficult for other websites (where we usually have to pay shipping) to compete with Amazon.  That is why we end up placing most of our orders with Amazon.  Amazon prime was a smart idea.      What makes shopping on Amazon such a great experience is that alot of people write reveiws of the products on Amazon.  That helps us alot when we make our buying decisions.      I do not recall any bad experiences with the vendors who sell on the Amazon marketplace.   However, some vendors are slower than others.  If you order from an unfamiliar vendor, be prepared to wait.      So far, we have been very satisfied.   Hope they keep up the good work!

Amazon don‚Äôt care about consumer rights.  I bought a lawnmower, after I bought it they bumped the price by ¬£170, then told me it was lost in transit.  Really how can you lose a lawnmower.  The refused to send a replacement, but offered a refund, which meant that I would have to pay an extra ¬£170 to buy it again,  Really dodgy selling practises.  And a clear breach of my rights to get a replacement,

I've had 2 accounts closed because I supposedly violated terms and policies! How you ask from asking fro refunds on items that I had not received and they said they were delivered. When investigated I was told that they were indeed delivered when in fact they were not. I literally spent thousands on amazon. It's the best place to buy my Anime stuff. I would continue to spend thousands if it wasnt for my account being closed then I made a new one and it was immediately closed. Super upset and dissatisfied and disappointed especially when they didnt even consider were they were putting my packages or even that some of them would come weeks after saying they were delivered. They will steal you money and then call you a liar.DO NOT USE THEM!!!!

Amazon never fails! I‚Äôve had numerous things ordered since this lockdown and can genuinely say Amazon have been outstanding during this pandemic, ensuring no matter the circumstances they still keep a quality service!

I love shopping with Amazon.com because they make it so easy, and I am always satisfied with everything I buy.  They also offer so much in the product line.  I really like the ability to purchase music through the Amazon MP3 and choose only the songs I want, and the Amazon Cloud is great!

5/10/2023 - I find Amazon's customer assistance woefully lacking. It seems that those taking customer assistance calls lack knowledge of how their review system works. I have been trying to review 3 items I've recently purchased and Amazon is blocking me from doing so. The stated reason is that I'm not a verified buyer. If I purchase it on the Amazon site, how much more verified is that. When things like this happen, it feels like there is something nefarious going on between the seller and Amazon.I was told that I needed to wait for 24 hours after order before I could leave a review, but they couldn't explain why I've been able to review other goodss minutes after order.I was told that I would receive an email regarding my issue. It's been ten days and still no email. Very frustrating and very suspicious.
Review text not found

This is honestly one of the most gross things that have happened to me while ordering Amazon fresh I ordered mayo 20 FL OZ and it came it I have started opening my package and the state of the mayo was just oil with chunks of white s hit that looked like semen I shook the bottle to see a big blob the bottle was unopened still having it's seal didn't expire until September 17 2022 idk what temperature they keep there food in but it's obviously the wrong fuc king temperature to be sending out s hit like that that get the order two hours before delivery time and can't even realize they grabbed and bagged a disgusting looking mayo to be sent out
Amazon shipping is no longer reliable in terms of delivery times. The last 3 I ordered  have not arrived.

Fed up  waiting  in for delivery  the drivers sometimes  doesn't   knock just but card thought  your door  and just run off. The only  time I would  given Amazon 10 out 10 is for there lockers. Unfortunately they don't  have these  in Madeira. What a shame.

I ordered a cricut joy from Amazon and I picked the time they offered for delivery. When it didn‚Äôt show up at the time they promised, I discovered it was in Texas still. I live in Florida. I then found out it was being sold for $20. Cheaper. Because it was so late they gave me a discount and promised they would get it to me the next day. I saw it eventually made it to the Lakeland Amazon distribution center in Fl. 2am. In the morning. When I woke up, it was still there, but my other package that was there shipped and was out for delivery. At 3pm I called them and before they picked up my phone call a notice came across my phone saying it was being delayed. Ok, still waiting for them to pick up my call. Some guy finally answered, and said it got damaged and my only option was put my money back on Amazon credit or back to my account. After waiting three days extra and they did nothing to fulfill my order. I tried to write my review, but they wouldn‚Äôt publish my review because it wasn‚Äôt about the product. I could not find a place on Amazon to complain about there shipping, and there should be a place. I got my cricut joy and also bought a hammock elsewhere. They lost about $400. From me over shipping. I wish I could just not buy from them anymore, but from now on they are my last choice to do my business with.  Also the money they promised to give me on my account for the late shipment disappeared, so they just took back the machine and canceled my reimbursement. Shame on you Amazon.
Good, friendly support, quick and easy.
Products are overall pretty acceptable. But order is horrible. So many things have not been delivered on time. UPS delivered way better than Uber or prime order trucks. Very frustrating.

I bought a backpack with Fulfilled by Amazon and encountered a problem with payment processing which resulted in 1 day shipment delay. (they accepted my payment method, but later rejected it. They could've rejected on the spot and I would've tried to sort it out immediately) This annoyed me because it defeats the purpose of me paying a premium for AmazonGlobal Expedited Shipping which values S$18.44. I shared my concern with Amazon customer support and they promptly waived my total shipping & handling fees of S$25.65 to S$0. I thought it was a courtesy talk-only customer service, but 5 minutes after the live chat ended, the change reflected. I was amazed. With this, it's enough for me to trust Amazon and shop confidently with Amazon.com in the future ^_^

If I could give you a stars I would. I am not sure how Amazon delivery services cannot read an address. I'm going to assume that they use GPS location when they're delivering products. So how do items get delivered to a completely wrong address not even the correct street. I have no idea where my items went. But I have a picture and according to Amazon I can "check to see if someone else has it"... Well I shouldn't have to. That's why I pay for Amazon prime! Worst part is, the items today are things I really needed this evening!! Ugh!!
I have had many items from amazon. Like they products and delivery very good to excellent.

I ordered a EGO mower via Amazon.com ($5300 purchase). The shipping company the seller used refused to deliver the mower to my home and it was sent back to the seller without ever being in my possession. Amazon has a A-Z guarantee that states they will refund your money if an item is not delivered. Today I got an email from Amazon stating that I am not eligible for the a-z guarantee and therefore will not refund my money. No explanation of why they say I am not eligible.   I have been a loyal customer for many years and recommended them to many of my friends. No longer will I do any business with them and will tell my friends to not use them also. I would rather spend more and pay shipping on items than give them one more cent of my money.

The store needs a total overhaul, function is LOST in search and sort. The site CHANGES DEPARTMENTS when advancing to the next page of results, which also changes your results. There must be no management whatsoever on navigation and how the store functions. It is not worth the prime membership anymore. The people in charge at amazon clearly do not care.
Best overall customer services I've ever known from an online retailer, hope it keeps up. Maybe just pay your taxes then I'd have no qualms about buying more expensive things...

2024 has been one unpredictable shipment after another. When purchasing, you are given choices as to shipment dates. Purchase may be averaged between dates. However, when promised same day or next day, the on going accuracy has been off by a couple days and the tracker is slow to update until items are within minutes of house. It's hot and I'm old, so grabbing before ruined is sometimes a factor and scheduling when I'll be there to take it inside.
What Amazon is doing is to make money on your return by holding your money for 30 days or more.SHAM ON AMAZON

AMAZON, VERY POSSIBLY THE WORST BIG COMPANY ON THE PLANET WHEN IT COMES TO CUSTOMER CARE,,, IT SHOULD BE, "CUSTOMER (WE DO NOT) CARE"!Now, I have no problem with saying that parts of the issues stem from my somewhat limited computer skills and my eventual loss of patience. The loss of patience however, was exacerbated by the Amazon System and the people I had eventually encountered.The System: I believe Amazon is one of the biggest companies on the planet and deals with such large volume of commerce giving them EXTREME POWER OVER SOCIETY AS A WHOLE,,, CONTROL OVER SELECT GROUPS,,, AND AS FAR AS THE INDIVIDUAL GOES... GREASE FOR THE GEARS! Amazon (and other huge companies highly advanced in technology) want to eliminate the "Human Factor" from their companies. They want ALL COMMUNICATIONS to be done with bots/A.I. on their end of the transactions... keep taking money from people to continue their automation and computerization. THEN, AS WAS WITH ME, the System failed. A $30 golf club arrives in bent box, broken in half. Needed to ask a question, (may have been somewhat or partially answered in their jumble of "prepared answers" if not in the first 50 or so maybe in the second group of 50 or so or 3rd group,,,). I struggled a bit but found a link to live chat. WHERE IT SEEMS MOST SITES YOU GO TO, YOU GET BOMBARDED WITH POP UP ADS,,, AND MOST JUMP RIGHT OUT WITH A, "LET'S CHAT NOW, WHAT CAN I HELP YOU WITH TODAY", I had to search around and when I got to the page, I started with a question, it said somethinglike,  "chat has been started , you are #1 in queue". About 20 minutes later, I did what they wanted, I ENDED THE CHAT, WITHOUT EVER GETTING ANY REPLY. So next is the attempt to call. Forget it. Not after West Coast work hours, unless you do not mind talking with some whoever, from wherever on the other side of the planet. I mind. Conversation with foreign dialect/accents is tough enough then add the stress brought about by personal and financial information in a world loaded with scammers and con artists. After running into a couple of walls with offshore AND NONE OF THEM ARE INTERESTED IN GETTING YOU ANY HELP WITH CONTACTING A U.S. REPRESENTATIVE FOR THE COMPANY. EVEN GETTING TO SPEAK WITH A SUPERVISOR IS A BATTLE WITH SOME.SO,,, I call the U.S. Corporate phone #. WORTHLESS! IF AMAZON IS LOOKING WHERE TO SAVE SOME WASTED MONEY,,, ELIMINATE THE "CUSTOMER SUPPORT CALL CENTER", ABSOLUTELY WORTHLESS. HEARTLESS. SOULLESS, UNCOMPASSIONATE GROUP THAT DO VERY LITTLE TOWARD HELPING (ME ANYWAY),,, AND THEY LIE! CHECK Y'ALLS RECORDINGS! The U.S. CUSTOMER SUPPORT PHONE #, basically 5 prompts. 1- customer service- gives recorded instructions to GO ONLINE. 2- instructions. 3- instructions. 4- instructions. Prompt #5- THE LIVE PEOPLE THAT DIRECT YOU TO CONTACT CUSTOMER SERVICE,,, THEY ARE JUST THE CALL CENTER,,, CUSTOMER SERVICE IS THE NUMBER I CALLED THAT EVENTUALLY RETURNS TO THEM!WHEN YOU START GETTING LOUD BECAUSE THEY ARE NOT LISTENING WHEN YOU TELL THEM THAT DOING WHAT THEY TOLD ME TO DO DIDN'T WORK AND ASK "NOW WHAT?",,, THEY THEN HANG UP ON YOU. AFTER TRYING TO EXPLAIN THAT THEY EITHER AREN'T LISTENING OR DON'T UNDERSTAND, THEY HANG UP ON YOU. BETWEEN THE SYSTEM ITSELF AND THE LIVE AGENTS IN THE CALL CENTER IN SEATTLE WASHINGTON, I CONTINUED TO CALL JUST TO GET A SCRIPT READ TO ME SAYING THEY HAVE GIVEN ME ALL THE HELP AND GUIDEANCE AVAILABLE AT THEIR LEVEL AND THEN HANG UP ON ME... WOULD NOT TELL ME WHAT TO DO WHEN WHAT THEY HAVE TOLD ME TO DO DOESN'T WORK.It concludes with a final attempt at 1 of many AMAZON CUSTOMER SERVICE #s. A guy in India that said he was a supervisor with the "escalation team", highest level you can get by phone he said, but I had spent literally HOURS dealing with the Devil, and it boils down to AMAZON UPPER LEVEL COULD CARE LESS WHAT HAPPENS UNDER THEIR FEET AS LONG AS THEY ARE CONTINUALLY BLINDED BY THE MONEY.

you cant get through to customer services it cuts you off the minute you call they send labels you cant use if you cant use a computer you are stuck amazon wont help you l asked for a straight forward label to take to my evri shop across the road they sent me one you have to print..l dont know how to use a computer .. customer service are arrogant and unhelpful l dont recommend either amazon or ebay

When you are able to speak to an agent, they offer compensation however this is never actually applied to your account. The last adviser I spoke to Hazel was very rude. I attempted to report her however was unable to do so.
I am not happy nor sad. I bought LR44 cell.
Amazon will deliver your items alright but u will suffer sometimes before you receive itAnd their prices of some items are too expensive

Pretty wholistic service.  Online movies on demand, fast shipping, good return system.  My go to vendor for almost anything.  The non-amazon vendors on the amazon listings can be a little more sketchy.  Good stuff.

topped up my amazon account with ¬£200 from my debit card and amazon locked it. 3 weeks of sending in my bank statments, bank card and even a selfie with my drivers licence and they still wont unlock or even refund money back to the card it came from. customer service just giving you the same speech from a screen by sounds of it and saying its account specialists that deal with it and can only reach them by email. Joke of a company. AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE

I paid for an item and never received it. Amazon have not customer support option and only offer a return item option. Seller sent a pre scripted email and didn't bother to try to resolve the issue either. Amazon and the dodgy seller wiped their hands clean of the issue but happily kept my money. This is what i would consider an online scam. They only get away with it because their name is AMAZON.Update---------Amazon did eventually refund me for this item. The fault was with Royal Mail. They falsely claimed they delivered a parcel. I have a camera in front of my door. They lied.

The customer service is mediocre at best. I have been waiting for almost 2 weeks for someone to contact me and unlock my account even after I explained to them that it was hacked and the situation has since been resolved. They keep asking me about a "form" that I need to fill out, and then they say that they have completed the form and someone will contact me the next day. I've been hearing this every other day since 10/30/2020. I understand that there's a pandemic happening, but that should not stop the workers from doing their job in a decent timeframe.
Amazon is garbage. Will never get another penny from me. They only refunded half of my money and I can't get in contact with customer service. Smh
Some great, some not great. Product offering is fantastic. Markup on the cheap stuff is not. But if i Use their App then that is on me. Easy returns. Free shipping. Good to go

Amazon overall deliver a fine support but it can fall down when some of its suppliers provide a very average support. In my case I bought 3 cat Webbox  sticks from Staks and Co. They offered no return support. I paid ¬£8.19which I had assumed  was for 3 X 3 packets of Webbox Cat sticks and so I paid ¬£8.19. They sent me 3 so i paid ¬£2.73 eachper  packet when they only cost ¬£1.00 in Morrisons. Don't use Staks and Co unless you are very rich.   Oh and no returns.

Amazon is becoming more expensive with little benefit. Shipping delays. Wrong items received all the time where it becomes my responsibility to return the item or pay for an item I never ordered. Walmart plus has been great their customer service is so much better to deal with. Bye amazon.

I haven‚Äôt had a terrible usage but I also haven‚Äôt ever had a great usage with Amazon. It‚Äôs solid if you need something within a few days and you don‚Äôt have time to go to the store, but only if you actually order though Amazon and not one of the other sellers on the platform. Those are hit or miss, some are reliable and some are not.

They want to force you to subscribe to Amazon prime, if you don‚Äôt, they purposefully delay the shipment. Then they give you an approximate shipment date, eg. between the 10th - 15th of that month, it will always arrive on the last day! Why even bother saying it will arrive between these dates, if you will make sure it arrives on the very last day in any case? Does Amazon think that we are all stupid?

Recently I made 4 orders, they were accepted then two of them were out of stock.  That is 50% and totally unacceptable.  If internet companies publish and accept the order they should have it in stock and keep their inventory under control.  Disgruntles Customer.

NOT HAPPY! I placed a big order that cost 455$, i was not only charged 455 twice, but amazon is giving the hardest time about getting that payment back. i provided amazon with the upmost proof to show i was charged  twice. not only have i been dealing with dispute since 3/04/2020 now i am being ignore via email. when i call the agents are confused to what i am talking about. at this point i am canceling my account and will be doing business else where. i will say this is the first time it has happen since i been a customer since 2015. thanks Quilla

Fantastic range of products; from buying bargain books several years ago, Amazon is now my first port of call for just about everything - they rarely let me down for choice or competitive price.  If I need to replace my car in the near future  . . . . .

I am writing this only because I feel it needs to be said.  Amazon, I understand with Covid-19 shipments are delayed in shipping; however, please changed your page setting to not say "if you order in 3 hrs and 15 min" you have have your order the next day.  I am a prime member and pay my prime membership; however, I do base my orders on when I can receive them.  Telling people if you order in so many hours you can have your shipment by .... if is misleading and plain wrong.
i ordered goods using amazon prime  less  than 15 hours i just got it fantastic service highly recommend amazon prime

Best company to deal with, any time i have a small issue their customer service handles it

I use Amazon often.  There is a large selection of goods.Their delivery is stated so you know when to expect it, usually within estimated time.Never had any problems.Their subscribe and save is a good service for regular deliveries and save a little extra.

Amazon is a very fine support, however I can find nowhere to report a discrepancy between the comment the order driver made and the actuality! The comment read ‚Äúhanded to resident‚Äù. Not so, we were in and listening for the order - having tracked it. But no ringing of the bell or knocking of the door, just dumped.I‚Äôve tried to find a place on their web site to report this - it‚Äôs not the first time - to no avail!! Sad really as parcels they send by Royal Mail or other support always come with a ring or knock!! Making this a reliably, safe order. That‚Äôs really is my only complaint about an otherwise very fine company!
The packaging of Amazon is really good, but it's annoying to unpack. The 10000 tape packages are too much to unpack, but after we unpack, the quality of the package is impeccable.
Delivery was not on time but the Product was good.

Dont try to buy anything guaranteed same day. I haven't had anything delivered same day even though guaranteed. Full of excuses about things being out of their control. This time, the items I bought are Amazon items, not delivered same day because of delay but rescheduled for delivery today. Still nothing due to issues "beyond their control". Their warehouse is 15 minutes from my house. There were 3 Amazon vans in my housing area all at the same time while I was driving home from work. How can their product being delivered by their vans less than 15 minutes away be out of their control 2 days straight? Then, when I ask for a refund, I get the run around and my status on the orders say I refused the packages when they delivered. IT WAS NEVER DELIVERED!!! This is the 3rd time they pulled this crap. The first two times they promised gift cards (which I never received). I don't need them anyways. Goodbye prime, goodbye Amazon!!
Reliable for me when I order next day xxx
Helpful, easy returns, great prices, good reviews for products, which really helps when shopping for an item.  I use Amazon more than any other shopping website
Great company.  However, some workers with accents do not understand at all what I am calling about.  I wish we had the option to pick who we would like to talk with do that we can be understood.

Recently I ordered items based on the promise to deliver in two days being a Prime Member. However it has taken three days for the last three items to be delivered. One was promised next day shipment. It took two days.
'Amazon Next Day', really means 'End of Next Day'..... pointless!!!! Job will have to wait till next week.. If I had known was end of next day would have gone to DIY store üòï..

The shipping times are so bad now, thinking of canceling prime. Ordered a video game that shipped last Saturday with 2 day shipping and it's still not here. Not lost, just moving extremely slow. It's been in my state since yesterday, in a city 30 minutes away and it's still moving slow.

Sharp decline in assistance. When I started using Amazon about a year ago my main concern was if I could return items if they didn't work out. I tore up my knee and can't get out to do my purchases and Prime seemed to be a fine option aat that time. I could use Prime video and returns were easy. I could take my return to the UPS store half a blck away and they would print my label, scan the item and done!  Recently everything has changed for the worse. They no longer use the same courier company and all the options for drop off are too far for me due to the mobility issues. The free pick up option looks fine until you spend the entire day waiting for the pick-up only to get notified at 9pm that you have been rescheduled for the next day. This goes on for days sometimes. I'm sorry, you wanted to shower or take your dog out to pee? Too ordinary. Most recently I recieved the okay from customer assistance to leave my pick up at the door and when I got out of the shower they had only picked up one of the two items that were in the same box. By the way, contacting customer assistance is almost impossible. Good luck finding the link to request a call or actually talking to a person. The AI call doesn't give you the option to talk to a person, you have to know to say "talk to a person". The chat doesn't actually chat, it is just more self help. They don't want to know what their customers think.Then there is Prime Video. All the shows I was watching suddenly came with a price tag. The garbage that was left has comercials and isn't worth watching. I haven't watched anything on Prime for weeks. I bought one movie that I will say finebye to if I cancel but it may be worth it.As for the items, hit or miss as usual. If I am familiar with a brand and it works for me it is usually a safe bet. Otherwise it definitely is a gamble.
Wife's account has been hacked amazon offered 0 help even put the phone down on her bank. More and more people getting in  other using it

I absolutely love Amazon! Also, I tried out their Prime membership and it's to die for. I always get quick deliveries and I know that my package will be there when I get home. I have never had any issues with Amazon and I have already recommended it to so many people!If you haven't purchased anything from Amazon I would recommend you do just to try it out. You wont be disappointed.
Worst place to order from.Everything comes from overseas and the boxes be filthy.Theres so many covid cases at Amazon and they do not deep clean.Dead bugs and maggots are all over the building
Consistent as always. no issues.

Sadly, Amazon Prime is no longer Prime! My last 4 orders have not been delivered on time. It seems the Phonex facility doesn't care about On Time Deliveries. Plus they have a ordinary habit of losing packages. I know that Phonex is only 1.5 hours from Tucson and I know they make several stops along the way, but, if it takes a driver over 12 hours to make his trip, you need new drivers!

Recently they start sending the verification link to your phone. By some reasons it never comes to some of the phones because of the notification format or cell provider setup or by some other reason. When you call them the first time they say it is a system glitch and should be fixed in 24 hours. And as you can imagine it never happens.  Attempting to reset that over their 800 number is just waste of your time. I spent several hours on the phone with them. I gave them all the information they needed including the phone #, credit card numbers, billing address, email, last transaction codes from my bank statement but this is not enough!  They ask you to name last three purchased items and if you do not remember the exact names of the items you purchased  you can not pass their security check!  Is not this weird? These guys become crazy. I am not going to use them any more. I hate all that. And I feel sorry for my time and nerves.
Oh Amazon, what would I do with out you.üòÄüëåAmazing products, amazing price, lots of choices and above all, the best customer service ever. No one compares to amazon.

Amazon deserves negative stars.  I have (had) been a customer for DECADES.  Today I had my credit card information stolen.  Someone used my credit card that is tied to my bank account to place several online orders with various vendors.  I contacted three of them to report the issue, after I contacted the bank that issues my credit card.  All three vendors immediately stopped payment on the fraudulent orders and assured me that my bank account would be reimbursed within 48 hours.  However, when I contacted Amazon Customer Support to report fraudulent use of my credit card, this is what I encountered:  (1) Asked for last 4 digits of credit card used; (2) name on card; (3) date and amount of charge - I provided all of this information.  Support indicates that yes my card was used for that amount on the date provided, but the name on the account was different, and that I had to provide any "guesses" as to the name that was used on the account.  Seriously, take a guess.  Hello, you are asking me to identify someone that stole my credit card information!  When I could not take a "guess" as to the name on the account, I asked for the name that was used and I was denied this information because Amazon had to "protect the name used".  So let's just protect the person that stole my information and not provide me with any help.  This went back and forth for several minutes.  I asked for the name and contact information for an Amazon Supervisor and this was denied.  I indicated I wanted the charge taken off of my credit card - denied - told it was my bank's responsibility, not Amazon's.  I explained how other vendors immediately did not question the fraudulent charges, and removed them ASAP.  Oh and let's not forget.  Last week I placed an order with Amazon, and afterI reported the fraudulent issue, I received an email that my payment was being denied for fraudulent use. At first, I really loved using Amazon.  Their two-day shipment was spot on, and I could order anything and trust the goods.  Now, it feels like I‚Äôm always trying to check with myself as to why I‚Äôm paying this membership!  Two-day shipment is bs.  I‚Äôve had several two-day shipment packages be delayed.  One was a birthday present for my 6 year old nephew.  We postponed leaving until the next morning because Amazon said the shipment would be there in two days.  Right at the 9pm end of day shipment mark, Amazon sends a shipment delay note saying it may not be for another 5 days.  The tracking showed it was in my city.  Why would that take 5 days?!  Im beginning to wonder what I pay this membership for.  The two day shipping has gone to the wayside, and I‚Äôm beginning to not believe in Amazon‚Äôs promise any more...or the quality of the goodss sold.  Don‚Äôt say you can do something if you can‚Äôt. I ordered a patio umbrella on Aug. 1, 2021 on Amazon which I received. I have my credit card record showing the transaction. I needed to order a broken replacement part, only to discover there is no record of the purchase on Amazon itself in my order history so I contacted the company, Best Choice Products. They also had no record of my purchase. They can do nothing without my order ID number. I contacted Amazon Customer service chat online and repeatedly (3X) got what was obviously not a real person but an AI. I asked "Are you a real person or an AI?" and was told "I am a real person", but the responses were still like a programmed AI. I said, "What is your favorite ice cream?" because an AI would not be set up to respond. Sure enough, no answer. I wrote, "I am not sure you are a real person so if you answer that question, I'll know." The response: "I am a real person" which is the exact phrase that is always used. It's triggered by the phrase "real person". He refused to answer a simple question about ice cream so I knew it was an AI yet again. I finally gave up because it just kept going around in circles because its coding couldn't handle the complexity.  Shame on Amazon for lying to its customers that its customer service help are 'real people'.

I purchased an android 5G capable phone, on startup it took over an hour to complete, storage was 30% used - 70% available. It never recognized my fingerprint to unlock apps, and ran slower than my 3G android. I inquired a better refund explaining that I am mobile impaired. They insisted that I needed to bring it to the post office and send it that there was no way to have it picked up. Discontent but still agreeing I ordered a new phone upon its arrival I began to switch insensitive apps to the new phone and everything appeared to be fine I searched the internet so that I could probably factory reset the other phone to clear my data. I then began to reenter passwords and log into accounts and verify the IP address to the new device when I noticed that I didn't have administration rights on the new device because it hadn't completely wiped the old device and fragments of the applications remained. Which meant I needed to reboot the First new phone that I got so the IP address would register in the applications and I could make the transfer from within. After 4 hours of watching the screen turn and turn and tell me downloading and updating I powered off and put the phone away and try it again in a few hours. Extremely frustrated I called Amazon customer service back again today and made it very clear that they need to do something because I have to bring that phone now to a technician to have him go into the hard drive and extract my data. This is going to cost more than the phone is worth and Amazon refuses to do anything. I will happily return the phone but somebody needs to come and get it. It's winter time in Quebec I am mobile impaired how in the world do they expect me to get to a post office

I am giving Amazon three stars because I have had one positive and one negative interaction with Amazon customer assistance over many years. I ordered a settee from Amazon and was given a order date of Thursday.  All day Thursday Amazon showed that the settee was scheduled to arrive by 8 PM. It never arrived. I understood all of that, but on Friday the Amazon organization lost their credibility with me. On Friday, I received an email from Amazon saying they had a glitch and they would let me know when my item shipped and when it was expected to arrive. I read that to mean it could arrive in a week, six weeks, two months. I called customer assistance to get a more specific order date; they said they didn't know. I was told to call back next week to see if they had more information. They would give me no information as to why there was a delay in order. I have been a Prime member since the beginning and an Amazon customer long before that. I have never been left with such incompetent, open-ended information in my extended interaction with them. Perhaps they're getting too big for their boots.

AMAZON is great. One thing missing from AMAZON is their inability to promote books posted or published on their websites. Doing so, does not translate to an endorsement of a book, rather informative to the audiences worldwide. The AMAZON prominence position them to champion this option. Because the idea of listing a book title on their portal, without publicity, is like planting a flower without intention to add water for germination. Development of "AMAZON BookTV" where such is platformed is no a average idea considering the corporate standard.

I ordered an Amazon Fire stick. It was supposed to be delivered on 6th June 2023.I received an shipment confirmation on email. It stated the parcel had been delivered at reception. To be told the shipment status was updated too early. Strange‚Ä¶ Apologies were given and the new shipment date was 8th of June 2023.Surprise, surprise‚Ä¶the parcel still didn‚Äôt arrive on 8th June. I explained they are in breach of contract the fines never arrived and funds have been taken. I asked for a full refund.To be fair, after the advisor had spoke to their boss. I've just been told that my item won't be released unless I pay ¬£32.  The item itself was ¬£52 and I paid ¬£52 for delivery.  That means that costs have now exceeded the value of the goods.  Absolutely ridiculous.My options are to pay, or let the item be returned.  I have to add that I didn't buy this item off Amazon but when I told Parcelforce Coventry that I'd ordered high value items in the past with no problems, she said that I'd just been lucky not to have received a surcharge. Check where your items are coming from before you take the gamble.

We bought a Danby DAR044A4WDD compact fridge after seeing 4 stars average from 594 Amazon customer reviews. Looked at questions answered also, stating the door was reversible. I took a minute to search by model number and there was ONE review on this model. The site clumped 13 different models, including outmoded ones, into one set of reviews making the reviews misleading and useless. It arrived in one day - door is no way reversible on THIS EXACT model. Luckily we don't care except I don't like being misled. This is not the first time I've discovered this practice - check out Amazon purchaser reviews of Panasonic NNT-945SF Microwave or Green Mountain Nantucket Blend K-Cups. Reviews are grouped, ALL purchasers of Genius microwaves of any model, ALL flavors of Green Mountain. Useless! Last month we bought a Little Tykes coupe from Quidsi an amazon store, then discovered that the same thing with a trailer was available through Amazon directly. Went to cancel the first one WITHIN FOUR MINUTES and we couldn't because it had "shipped". We had to take order and return it which cost us $14 UPS. What a scam...  Other than constantly and increasingly dealing with questionable information, if you do research on several websites and don't rely on Amazon to make your decisions, then you know EXACTLY what you want, they are quite amazingly fine.

This review is regarding Amazon and their misleading advertisements, which this is hardly the first time they have been accused of such and likely not the last settlement they have to pay out due to misleading statements. During the wake of our current pandemic they choose to keep profits high by making unachievable promises to unsuspecting customers regarding their shipping policies. I also a fool agreed to sign up with Amazon prime and pay 119$ a year for this two day shipping reward. As I checkout excited at the decision I made only to discover I will be lucky to receive my shipment in 3 weeks. Upon inquiring with a customer service representative they chose to guilt me as of why I expect my shipment as previously promised to me two minutes prior when they are too busy sending out medical equipment for healthcare professionals. Of course we all understand the need and importance of medical equipment at a time like this, but why are you tricking people into signing up if you know that you aren't able to supply what is promised. Of course her response was, "well just cancel your order then." Which of course can be done, but it's the principal of it all and their willingness to profit off of the unsuspecting and unaware. We all know how this works, no one remember to cancel in time or they are elderly or disabled and unsure of the process. Now they are not even required to supply what is advertised. Most would be understanding had they been truthful at the start, but to fabricate and make false statements and to guilt customers for asking for what was just offered to them is bad business in itself. Now had I signed up a year ago and there was no way of predicting the outcome of what could happen it would be reasonable, but covid 19 has been present and affecting all for months now. If you can't supply as promised then take the advertisement down instead of continuing to mislead consumers. Of course our star customer service members response was now, "I don't know why they haven't took down the advertisement yet, they are probably busy with all this covid stuff." My....how I should chose my words wisely....as if removing a single line of advertisement will take months to do. While they are so busy saving the world from Covid 19. Thank you Amazon. I got a laugh at least, even if I didn't get my shipment. Until next time, which will be sooner than you think.
My package was 2 days late!! Come on Amazon, that isn't very like you!

I am giving Amazon three stars because I have had one positive and one negative usage with Amazon customer support over many years. I ordered a settee from Amazon and was given a shipment date of Thursday.  All day Thursday Amazon showed that the settee was scheduled to arrive by 8 PM. It never arrived. I understood all of that, but on Friday the Amazon organization lost their credibility with me. On Friday, I received an email from Amazon saying they had a glitch and they would let me know when my item shipped and when it was expected to arrive. I read that to mean it could arrive in a week, six weeks, two months. I called customer support to get a more specific shipment date; they said they didn't know. I was told to call back next week to see if they had more information. They would give me no information as to why there was a delay in shipment. I have been a Prime member since the beginning and an Amazon customer long before that. I have never been left with such incompetent, open-ended information in my extended usage with them. Perhaps they're getting too big for their boots.

Purchase an item on the 24th aug 2023 , item was being sold by Amazon eu and advertised as in stock at time of sale . After sale I was informed delivery time to be confirmed. Nearly every day since purchase item has been advertised as in stock by Amazon eu . After contacting Amazon I was informed that the item was not in stock and also told that (in stock ) does not mean the item is in stock . Hear is what happened on 11/8/23 , the item said 13 in stock and while speaking the phone a Amazon advisor was able to tell me that there was now only 12 available while we were speaking, I asked the advisor could I not have one of the 12 and was told that is not how it works (lol) . So I pay for the item and Amazon won't deliver it but won't deliver it when it is clearly in stock and can't provide a delivery date . So if you see a item you like and is in stock, understand that the term (in stock ) written on a advertisement on Amazon platform does not actually mean (in stock) and what it does mean is very unclear.

1) Amazon had a listing of what seemed like a counterfeit product (<$500 price tag for what should have been a $2k item.)2) Amazon representative told me that they personally vetted the product and that it's authenticated. I have screenshots of this conversation.3) I ended up buying the product. When I received it, it was obviously fake. Still, I paid a professional authenticator and they confirmed that it's counterfeit.4) I reported this to Amazon, they apologized, but they did not allow me to post my review on the seller's product page!In short, Amazon sold me counterfeit AND is covering up for a seller who should not only be banned, but reported to authorities.Forgot to mention, I'm a "prime" customer, who had easily spent multiple 5 digits with this garbage business, not out of love, but out of necessity. This is what you get when you allow psychopaths to have monopoly over the market, and then you push small businesses to shut down during a pandemic.EDIT:Remember the fake bag I bought, which the seller only had ONE of? Well, the merchant, now has a mysterious 5 star review that says "Love it!"Except this review was posted while I was in possession of the one bag. Sooo either they're lying about stock levels to create false scarcity, or they're creating fake reviews. Take your pick.

I've been a monthly customer of Amazon for years and have 2 primary complaints about the online shopping assistance. 1)I gave fare/honest reviews of merch I purchased - mostly an adequate rating, a few average and a few excellent reviews - but Amazon removed my ability to review for a couple years now without adequate explanation. I feel duty bound to warn other customers about items I've purchased that are advertized fraudulently or defective, which Amazon does not allow me to do. I expect Amazon as a middleman assistance suffers from conflict of interest when it comes to the various companies for which they brokers, so it censors reviews for the businesses it's too close to, in order to protect its sells. This is siding with these companies that sell substandard merchandise against Amazon members, and should immediately stop. Ever paying Amazon shopper should have an unhindered right to review the items they paid for.2) Amazon listings needs to clarify differences in sizing scale when merch is manufactured in different countries, which it most often fails to do. For example, I cannot tell you number of times I purchased items manufactured in China, according to Chinese sizing scale - which is about 2-sizes smaller than US sizing - without being warned by Amazon. The result being, merchandise That doesn't fit - clothes, backpack, laptop case - I either haveto go through headache of returning, just givaway, or trash.

*DO NOT TRUST AMAZON*Everyone who has EVER purchased anything on Amazon check all of your bank statements very closely. Look for Prime that you have never subscribed to also for Amazon Music. When you place an order with a third party seller, they (Amazon) have a habit of "accidentally" signing you up to one of these subscription services and charging to ANY CARD that has been used to buy a product. Even if it is not in the name of the person who holds the Amazon account.Example! My 70 year old mother was being billed for Amazon music, she did not even know about this. It went on for months. Finally yesterday I got to the cause of it and Amazon has agreed to refund ALL 8 wrongfully claimed payments from a pensioner. That amounted to almost ¬£80 STOLEN from a vulnerable person.They also agreed to refund the ¬£9.99 STOLEN from my card. It only came to my attention when I used my mothers Amazon to order an item from a third party seller. When I checked my card. I had been charged ¬£9.99 for Amazon music, as my mother's registered card was lost and had to be cancelled and replaced. So Amazon took the money without authorisation from my account. Just to add. I have now been charged ¬£1 by amazon only a day after this scamming, thieving, fraudulent bunch of vultures "apologised" for stealing money. I therefore deleted both my card and my mother's card from amazon. I suggest EVERYONE does the same. If you buy anything on Amazon, DO NOT STORE YOUR CARD!!! Simply input it for each transaction. Your money is NOT SAFE!! Better than that NEVER USE AMAZON. We never will again!!Had this not happened, and I had not been charged my mother would never have known about this and Amazon would have continued pocketing her money. My review relates to author's whose books are listed on there.  I would not buy anything from them at this stage, even if they paid me to do so.  When the company receive a DMCA, staff member 'Chad' will claim that he's unable to read, despite working in a legal department.  He will insist that you re-send the DMCA several times before it is accepted.  It is often better to leave Amazon as a last resort, email all other contacts first, because they normally resolve the issue while Amazon are still claiming that they can't find your address, or some other detail, on the DMCA in front of them.  Unfortunately, you will probably have to deal with Amazon, because they host a large number of the illegal download sites.  As regards illegal book download sites, you will notice that any inaccuracies stated on Amazon are copied onto the illegal download sites. As regards inaccuracies stated on Amazon; edits to one Amazon site will not carry over onto the other sites, you have to edit each individually.  They will not delete your books, even if they are out of print, or were never available for sale.  They allow book sellers to make any changes they wish, but deny that right to the copyright owner.  This is because they derive a monthly income from book sellers and they want you to pay that fee as well, so although there is an 'author central' for UK, France, Germany, Japan and America, they will often ignore your edits, complete them incorrectly, or claim that you wish to edit something they are not able to edit.  I would note that not all the Amazon sites are completely incompetent and I will do separate reviews for those, having now dealt with all of them.    The American site are rude and unwilling, they take an absolute age to make the simplest of edits and willfully admit that they have people registered as the 'copyright owner', or 'publisher' of work not owned by the registrant - when asked to elaborate or provide details, they will refuse to do so, thereby willingly and knowingly supporting copyright and royalty theft.  'Mike Hammer' of Amazon (US) will eventually send you a supervisory email, after you've received multiple emails from the 'team' about unrelated issues, suggesting that they do not understand your edit, or their job.  His email will inform you that the correct way to edit Amazon US is to fill out the 'Report a Problem' form on each page, as members of the public do and then he will inform you that you could join 'seller central' (paid service), where you will be able to edit whatever you want - thereby giving an author less rights to their own work than; publishers, thieves, the public, book sellers and of course; Amazon.  He will then abruptly inform you that 'this is Amazon's final response to this issue', like the sociopathic, pumped up incompetent he is and as such displaying his unfounded arrogance, as such people love to do, because it gives them a temporary feeling of unachieved superiority, which is much quicker than working for that stuff. Not only that, apparently Amazon pay minimal wage and low taxes, so there is little wonder that they are a billion dollar company, but only when there is no more art and no service amenities and all workers are living off food stamps will society realize that Amazon may be cheap, but its' company practice is not what the world needs and by then it will be too late, so for your own purposes;Only send them a DMCA when you have exhausted all other options.  Unless it is of huge importance, don't even bother contacting the American site regarding edits to their listings, if their incompetence doesn't get you, their attitude problem will.If your book has been listed incorrectly, you would be best advised to edit it on other sites, so that your other listings are correct.  Other book selling sites are only too happy to hear from an author and make appropriate edits, because good listings sell books and that is their business.  Don't waste too much time on Amazon and don't pay them any money, unless you really have to/want to.I would further note, unlike other companies listed on this site, there is no option to send your review to the company you are praising/complaining about.  Now, officially that will be because they are 'too busy', but given their standard of service, that is obviously incorrect.  The actual reason is that they have no interest whatsoever in what any of you think; good or bad.  They just want your money.

Delivery NO STARS: They mainly use UPS which has consistently lost or wrong address delivered packages. UPS refuses to take any fault for packages they lose or deliver to the wrong home, sometimes even in the completely wrong state or town which should be something easy to notice. But apparently as long as they delivered it, it shouldn't matter where and they shouldn't have to refund the item or replace it. It's absolutely disgusting business tactics and their affiliation with UPS Will only ruin their reputation as it continues. I RECOMMEND FINDING A SERVICE NEAR YOU OR ONLY ORDERING FROM CITES THAT USE FEDEX OR REGULAR POSTAL DELIVERY AND NOT UPS. Products 3 stars: pretty wide range of items you'll find anything you need. ALWAYS READ PRODUCT REVIEWS BEFORE PURCHASE. you'd be surprised what items actually pose the most issues but trust the most recent reviews and make your purchase accordingly. Customer support 5 stars: these guys are not playing games. If you lose money, theyr losing money to. Take advantage of customer support and be patient! Okay so my problem with amazon originally started as my fault, i put the wrong address. Instead of putting west I put east. Skeptical, I called in and the lady on the phone confirmed with me I would receive the package today at the corrected address.A few hours go by and I receive a call from the driver that he was at the wrong address, yet again, and when I gave him the corrected address he said it was outside of his delivery zone.So I call in again and after a 30 minute phone call of just trying to update my address for the following day, the guy told me he updated the notes and address. Address was still incorrect and delivery notes were deleted and he put that I wanted my order the following day.So I then do the chat thing again and they inform me to replace the order and I would get a full refund, which would've worked but I had ordered the last item in stock. So I ask if I can update the address and they tell me no and ask if I want to speak to a specialist.I understand the mistake was originally my fault but it is a simple mistake and I was willing to wait a few days to accommodate that but they have no basic understanding of what I am asking for.

I have shopped on Amazon for years. Most times the good are good and received in a timely manner. Returns have generally been OK with the odd blip for some farawy country where there is a lot of sharp practice. Amazon do not protect you from this. That said Amazon has a lot of problems:1. A customer service team which is difficult to access and does not do it's job. Its investigations are superficial and they give glib stock answers and frequently don't take appropriate action even when they say they will. A recipe for real customer frustration and I am VERY frustrated with this service.2. I have noticed 8 recurring charges of 17.99 on my account. I have tried to get them to investigate it. I got a stock answer about why this could be happening. So they have not investigated it - otherwise they would have known what the charges were for. I will get my bank to investigate this now.I also have nearly 8 consecutive charges for Prime membership, despite the fact I had cancelled it. They don't always action your cancellation. Sometimes I have 2 Amazon Prime charges within a couple of days or a couple of weeks. Are they telling me I caused this. I will now get my bank to investigate this too.3. Amazon goods are not necessarily cheaper. In fact I have paid over the odds for many things, but I have only found out after purchase.I am now done with Amazon. I believe either its digital platform is faulty, hence the charges or they have dishonest staff who access my card. I won't know which until the investigation is complete.I believe it is worth taking time over what you buy and if I have to pay a little more I will. I believe the safest way to shop is go to the shops. Amazon created a buzz around internet shopping but I have seen its flaws and belueve I am now actually out of pocket financially.

Amazon DecrepitudeI had trouble deciding whether to choose one or two stars for my review.In the past you could count on Amazon customer reviews to help you sort out whether a particular item was any good or not. Reviews would tell you about user experiences; how well the product worked, whether there were warranty claim issues, whether the item was suitable for a task, or even if a particular  vendor was untrustworthy or not.However, Amazon started adding Ratings which are not Reviews, simply some useless, lazy person simply giving stars (1-5) without any reason for the rating. Some products have tons of ratings without a single useful note giving a reason for the rating. This is especially infuriating when it comes to reviewing books. You click on what you think is a review and it turns out to be a rating, meaning there is no reason given for the star assignment. This is not very helpful to help you decide if you would be interested in purchasing a book.Later on Amazon removed all of the Comments that customers used to give additional information or commentary on a particular Review. This meant that warning about certain vendors failure to ship products on time, substituting products, shipping used items that were supposed to be new, or explaining why the negative review was a user caused, rather than a product problem.Removing the Comments on Reviews means that a TON OF HELPFUL information is gone resulting in the customer REVIEWS, are no longer as informative and helpful.Of course the worse thing that Amazon had done starting at least 10 years ago is that they lump reviews of different products together, presumably to make it appear that there are more reviews than actually exist. Whenever you purchase an product, you are invited, and encourage to leave a review, which is tied to the purchase of the exact item you purchased so there is no reasonable excuse for claiming that it is hard to connect the review to the exact item purchased. Amazon has all of the data that is needed to do this right.One terrible example of product Review LUMPING are those for Computer Hard Drives (HDs). Amazon lumps the reviews for old generation small capacity 500 Gb HDs, with all hard drives   made by a particular manufacturer with the largest capacity 18TB HDs. Now, the lower capacity HDs were designed and manufactured many years ago, using very different designs and components than those  newest, ultra high capacity HDs. These newest HD's that are very different from the older HDs, and use components that were produced most recently. We know that batches of components of the same design made at different times in factories may have quality control issues, hence Amazon's LUMPING practice defies reason and is DISHONEST.  Amazon will no doubt claim that their filtering menu takes care of this issue, but in fact that is false. You cannot evaluate the percentage of negative reviews (such as adding the two lowest star ratings together) without having these required data easily available. These are not easily found without counting every review. I certainly do not have time to do that, nor should that be required of anyone wanting to understand the review ratings. This would not be a problem if products that are not identical were not LUMPED together.LUMPING is misleading, and seriously dishonest, making it extremely difficult to make choosing a reliable product from Amazon. This practice should certainly stop, and the Review Comments should be put back if possible, and certainly re-instated.I have complained vigorously with customers support and even tried contacting Amazon upper management without success. Do away with LUMPING and get rid of Ratings instead of having Reviews! What will it take to get Amazon to fix these issues ?

Purchase an item on the 24th aug 2023 , item was being sold by Amazon eu and advertised as in stock at time of sale . After sale I was informed delivery time to be confirmed. Nearly every day since purchase item has been advertised as in stock by Amazon eu . After contacting Amazon I was informed that the item was not in stock and also told that (in stock ) does not mean the item is in stock . Hear is what happened on 11/8/23 , the item said 13 in stock and while speaking the phone a Amazon advisor was able to tell me that there was now only 12 available while we were speaking, I asked the advisor could I not have one of the 12 and was told that is not how it works (lol) . So I pay for the item and Amazon won't deliver it but won't deliver it when it is clearly in stock and can't provide a delivery date . So if you see a item you like and is in stock, understand that the term (in stock ) written on a advertisement on Amazon platform does not actually mean (in stock) and what it does mean is very unclear.

I love Amazon, for the supports they provide at the prices they provide them.  Subscribe and Save is one of the coolest things we have seen in twenty years.  We have been Amazon Prime members for almost two years. BUT, BUT, BUT - I do not like Bezos' politics and I hate making him richer. I hate the fact that Amazon is still streaming NRA TV. But that aside the organization has internal problems. The shipping dept is LOUSY and must be poorly run. One in four packages we receive are poorly packed, have no bubbly wrap to protect the goodss or poorly boxed and shipped. This probably has to do with the volume they are processing BUT they need more personnel if it is not being done right. Where are the supervisors? My guess is that no one is paid what they should be paid to work or supervise at the company. Another reason to hate Bezos and his only interest being seemingly in profit and the bottom line and not in the customers' usages. Typical corporate America. No matter how many decent things Amazon does they do not deserve a higher rating.

I've used 20¬£ gift voucher code and Amazon has blocked my account asking to provide a purchase receipt for the gift card, spoke to the customer service twice, explained it was a gift, so no receipt is avalable, provided with a screenshot of social media where the code from my friend was received, no result, they keep sending me the same request and wont unblock my account until receipt is received, also emailed the customer relationship team, total ignorance. Love the fact that you can order something and get it the next day.

No matter what I need, or the desire of my heart, I can typically find it at a great price on Amazon. I love the addition of Prime Shipping, and love that I can receive my orders within two days of ordering! I've purchased hundreds of items across a myriad of departments on Amazon, and have never EVER had an issue with returning an item that didn't fit or was not as described. I'm so grateful for Amazon, and recommend my friends and family to shop on Amazon for all their online shopping needs. Years ago, I used to shop on eBay, and found that the whole auction thing was actually kind of fun. However, I ended up having issues with fraud in my PayPal account, and realized that this would continue so long as I was forced to use a middleman to complete my online purchases. With Amazon, there is no middleman and never has been any fraud in my debit account that can be traced back to an Amazon purchase. They're very protective of their customers' financial information, and refunds are quick and easy. I will never, EVER shop eBay again, especially in light of how many scammers are starting to infest eBay's sellers market. It's really too bad that eBay doesn't do as good a job at protecting their customers as Amazon does. Thank you Amazon for being so awesome!
I am published author on Amazon, check my books and thank you Amazon for creating such platform.

Been a customer for few years and as time goes on I'm reminded why I was hesitant to create an account.  Don't get me wrong they have loads of brands, variety, and prices many times are better than the seller's own website's but all fine things on the surface have hidden costs. More than half the time order days change often without any explanations. Once I received a completely different goods than I ordered and couldn't get the proper goods from that seller so had to go through similar items to find a more pricey deal anyways. They did gift card the price but many times I've received items that barely resemble the ad and certainly weren't the quality the reviews said so it makes you wonder how do they stay on top? IMO humans are lazy, we don't want to have to go to five stores to get five types of things combined with free shipping that only seems free. I would also guess Amazon knows what other mega stores online or not do:you don't need the best quality if you have enough items just a bit cheaper than the competition and become a one stop shop. Ultimately my choice to go with Amazon for goodss, or not, isn't likely to change their business model as look at their profits year over year. But that's just one opinion among hundreds of millions and I've usaged some sellers that have quality goodss and they probably want a piece of the $$$ that comes with being connected to the fifth largest company worldwide, I can understand that. Good luck, read reviews and log every order.

So it's been 2.5 weeks, three of the same promises and apologies, no resolution and no phonecall as promised within 24 hours of each call. Shame on you Amazon for your poor customer service and while we know $700 is nothing to Bezos, to us middle class people, it's a lot.

I've been a monthly customer of Amazon for years and have 2 primary complaints about the online shopping support. 1)I gave fare/honest reviews of merch I purchased - mostly an adequate rating, a few average and a few excellent reviews - but Amazon removed my ability to review for a couple years now without adequate explanation. I feel duty bound to warn other customers about items I've purchased that are advertized fraudulently or defective, which Amazon does not allow me to do. I expect Amazon as a middleman support suffers from conflict of interest when it comes to the various companies for which they brokers, so it censors reviews for the businesses it's too close to, in order to protect its sells. This is siding with these companies that sell substandard merchandise against Amazon members, and should immediately stop. Ever paying Amazon shopper should have an unhindered right to review the items they paid for.2) Amazon listings needs to clarify differences in sizing scale when merch is manufactured in different countries, which it most often fails to do. For example, I cannot tell you number of times I purchased items manufactured in China, according to Chinese sizing scale - which is about 2-sizes smaller than US sizing - without being warned by Amazon. The result being, merchandise That doesn't fit - clothes, backpack, laptop case - I either haveto go through headache of returning, just givaway, or trash.

I've shopped at amazon.com for more than a decade now, and seen this web site rise up from a simple place to purchase books to one of the most reliable places to order just about anything. Amazon's customer service is so fabulous that if I can find the same thing available through amazon or somewhere else, I've often made the choice to purchase on amazon, thanks to its exceptionally reasonable return policies, and the fact that just about anything amazon ships is perfectly packaged and speedily shipped. Amazon now sells some items which are shipped through "third parties," and the same level of consistency in quality packaging, speedy shipping and items being as advertised may not always apply to such third parties. I especially love amazon's product reviews, and it's links to show what other customers often eventually purchase after viewing a particular item, and I love the way amazon makes it easy to quickly find and read both glowing and critical reviews, to ferret out the real scoop on a particular item. Reviews are voted upon, so more detailed and fair-minded reviews are easy to find, and shoppers can fast become well-educated on just about anything and everything. Amazon is also great for internet window shopping!

I tried to order a few Sony digital cameras from Amazon.  Once in my Cart, the system recommended cases for the cameras.  Good idea.  I ordered those, too.  However, the camera order was not fulfilled by the supplier.  Not Amazon's fault, however, Amazon still shipped the camera cases.  I wish they had asked if I still wanted those cases once the camera order was cancelled.  A company like Amazon could have easily found another supplier for the cameras.  They didn't, and told me to just re-order myself.  I originally ordered on Black Friday.  Prices have since gone up.  Amazon said it will not honor original pricing.  I'm now not rewarding Amazon with the re-order of the cameras.  However, I will be returning the camera cases that I now don't need.  Last, I put a negative review on Amazon.  However, they emailed to say they wouldn't put it up because reviews can't contain comments on Amazon customer service, only on products.  How nice.  They know the problem, could make it right, but won't, and now won't post the review because they don't want anyone else to know. Been with Amazon 17 years - even after they allowed my 13 yr old to order Amazon Prime without my knowledge.  May be time to find other online shopping options.

I've been a monthly customer of Amazon for years and have 2 primary complaints about the online shopping support. 1)I gave fare/honest reviews of merch I purchased - mostly an adequate rating, a few ordinary and a few excellent reviews - but Amazon removed my ability to review for a couple years now without adequate explanation. I feel duty bound to warn other customers about items I've purchased that are advertized fraudulently or defective, which Amazon does not allow me to do. I expect Amazon as a middleman support suffers from conflict of interest when it comes to the various companies for which they brokers, so it censors reviews for the businesses it's too close to, in order to protect its sells. This is siding with these companies that sell substandard merchandise against Amazon members, and should immediately stop. Ever paying Amazon shopper should have an unhindered right to review the items they paid for.2) Amazon listings needs to clarify differences in sizing scale when merch is manufactured in different countries, which it most often fails to do. For example, I cannot tell you number of times I purchased items manufactured in China, according to Chinese sizing scale - which is about 2-sizes smaller than US sizing - without being warned by Amazon. The result being, merchandise That doesn't fit - clothes, backpack, laptop case - I either haveto go through headache of returning, just givaway, or trash.

Seriously thinking about canceling my Amazon Prime Membership.I will never buy anything of value on Amazon again after Amazon‚Äôs latest screw up.I had saved up for close a year for a new IPad.My present one is cracked and hardly works.I ordered the new iPad through my Prime Membership. At 1st, Amazon claimed that it would arrive the very next day.That changed to two days, which I was fine with. I paid a friend to hang out and get the iPad from the Amazon driver. I did this because this was an expensive item and I didn‚Äôt want anything to happen to it. The tracking information said the iPad would arrive between 11:45am and 2:45 pm. Only 6 stops away. Later, I saw that the iPad had been delivered!Great, I thought!I got home around 5:30pm and asked my friend where‚Äôs the iPad?He told me that No Amazon Track or Driver dropped off anything at the front door?What, I exclaimed!I immediately tried to contact Amazon Customer Service, which is a total nightmare and not much help, other than asking if I had checked my front porch?No, it‚Äôs not on the front porch!Customerservice told me that the iPad was delivered because it says so?OMG, what‚Äôs wrong with these people.Usually Amazon takes a photo of where the driver left the item.In my case, there was No Photo!So, an hour later I was speaking with an Amazon supervisor.I explained everything for the 20th time.Only to be told, please wait another day?I asked if I could get another tracking number for a time of arrival? No Can Do!If the iPad hasn‚Äôt arrived by the end of the 3rd day, please call back and file a claim.Well that day came and went, No IPad.I‚Äôm presently taking Amazon to Small Claims Court to get my money back.So, the moral of the story is,Think Twice Before You Order Anything Of Value From Amazon!Because if anything goes wrong, You Are On Your Own!Amazon=Buyer Beware!

I already spent 15 min talking to someone just before the above chat that then screwed up.So it is simple give me to your supervisor now.Yogesh Siddheshwar: I'm so sorry, but we can't accept your request.Me: Yes you can.I have told you the issue.Yogesh Siddheshwar: Is there anything else that I can help you with?Me: Yes you can transfer me to a supervisor.Yogesh Siddheshwar: Except that?Me: I am not asking for something that is crazy or out of the ordinary.Give me a supervisor.Yogesh Siddheshwar: I'm so sorry, but we can't accept your request.Me: Give me to your supervisor. You can do this unless there is no supervisor there and I do not believe that to be the case for one moment.Yogesh Siddheshwar: I'm so sorry, but we can't accept your request.Me: Give me to your supervisor. You can do this unless there is no supervisor there and I do not believe that to be the case for one moment.Yogesh Siddheshwar: Unless there is a different issue I can help you with, I will be ending this chat.Me: You need to help with the request as it is not unreasonable and I told you the issue.Yogesh Siddheshwar from Amazon.com has left the conversation."After the third chat I final got a supervisor. When it was not I contacted Amazon this morning and after waiting almost 20 min online to speak to a supervisor they transferred me to another rep and not a supervisor.  He then told me that I may have to wait until tomorrow to get my packages that were supposed to be delivered yesterday. I never have this issue when they use fedex or UPS or USPS just the Amazon delivery service.Update: They just ended another chat on me Me: Are you refusing to transfer me to your supervisor?This is a simple yes or no question. I am still awaiting a refund from an item I returned in December 2019! I ordered a Xmas gift from Amazon at the end of November, they sent the wrong item, I returned it and asked for the order I had originally purchased to be sent!  The order was WRONG again!  I spoke to Amazon twice about this and and asked for a refund.  I returned the order and did not receive any email at first to say they had received it.  On 2nd January I rang them, they said they had received it and I would have a refund.  On 8th January I received an email saying they had received it.  I rang again and Amazon said it would take 5-7 days to receive a refund.  A week later I rang AGAIN!  They said they would refund but it would AGAIN take 5-7 days from the call to receive a refund!  I have rung TODAY and been assured I will now receive my refund!  The lady today - Joanna - was good on the phone unlike one of her previous colleagues who was very curt on the phone, however she said she would email me to confirm the refund was going through and I am yet to receive that email - here's hoping!  In 2018 I had problems with Xmas orders not arriving at all and late refund payments.  I was hoping that a YEAR on, the service would have got better.  It HASN'T!

I used to be a faithful buyer from Amazon, they used to be my first stop when shopping, but no more.  They raised the minimum purchase for "SuperSaver Shipping" from $25 to $35, making it tougher to save money on shipping costs.  Then they started charging sales tax, which adds 7% to the cost of anything I buy from Amazon.  I no longer stop at Amazon first to buy as they always seem to be a more expensive place to shop.  It is a shame Amazon, I spent a bundle at your store in the past, but no more!
