At Amazon the customer service representatives are not trained well and Amazon does not care. For instance, I bought a $ 5373.98 zero turn motor from a third party seller on Amazon. I had to summit an A to Z claim because I received a damaged unusable mower due to a crushed mower deck underneath unit. I won the claim at first but an Amazon employee  told me that I won it and since my banking services (Amazon visa credit card) due date was in a day or two,  he told me to dispute it with credit card, because it was  refunded and I wouldn‚Äôt be penalized for the dispute.  So A to Z took refund back, if you dispute the amount on your credit card A to Z won‚Äôt honor their refund.   Amazon didn‚Äôt care even if I had submitted a  Notarized witness statement of a friend visiting and who heard speaker phone calls.  Also had an witness to mover problems. Then Amazon told me to cancel dispute again. That this change would get my refund back.  Again she witnessed the speaker phone conversation. I just got lucky she was here.  Amazon took no responsibility for their workers statements concerning making or canceling the  credit card dispute in the first place and then they just dropped it.  They would not pay the return shipping and the seller will not.  This seller had bad BBB score and complaints. So I have re disputed with credit card with no other recourse. So Amazon is not your friend. So started shopping others sites with free shipping and returns. Wow I beat Amazon prices to heck and back. From 50 to 15 percent on every item plus no tax, too.  I took a friends new monthly statement of $4376.00 and shopped  those items. (They paid their bill off every month like I do.) The same exacted items, He would of saved big nearly $1000.00by buying with other non Amazon sellers was amazing (with free shipping and returns! WOW This was a shock. I think he is returning most of them. I told him to be careful with too many returns, (he likes prime streaming services,) they would bar him from Amazon, if they received to many returns.  I have decided I want to help people wake up and see the real Amazon. I want them to use Amazon not let Amazon use them.  I have Several meetings arranged with different groups this month. I will address and make aware of the Ins and outs with Amazon. I call it ‚ÄúAmazon Ain‚Äôt Your Friend‚Äù. I compare Amazon to Sears in the late1800- 1930. And Amazon will fall too.  I just do not ever want Amazon to rip off another person. They obviously don‚Äôt check out their sellers. At the end of this month, I am canceling prime ASAP. I am not stupid, I want to finish using bonus points. Got 40 dollars to go. You can keep your Amazon-visa credit card and used your points against your statement balance. Amazon has become an American Bad Habit and addiction. It would be a Tragedy for Americans to be left with only Amazon, once every other retailer goes bust because of them! Then u will be at the mercy of Amazon the Almighty!   I got a car and truck sign ordered ‚ÄúAmazon ain‚Äôt your friend‚Äù. So a new adventure awaits me. Good Luck. If you would like for me to give a presentation for your group, just email me, no can‚Äôt leave an email  but here‚Äôs my phone number 870-723-3625, send me a text, Attention Amazon issues. The presentation is free in the continental USA at this time. Also if I can help let me know.  I will check it out, but my opinion is Amazon doesn‚Äôt want their real policies known. I didn‚Äôt know you would lose an A to Z refund if amount was disputed on Amazon credit card. Who would of known. I couldn‚Äôt find anything information concerning A toZ refunds. This has never happened on eBay or pay pal. I had an 7800.00 dispute due the purchase of a truck. The engine blew up after delivery. I got my money back. Guys,  we the customers created a monster retailer, they have sold our information and got rich doing it. So that‚Äôs why I am doing this. I Hope I can help.  I bought a vlogging equipment from another business and returned the one from Amazon. Saved 50 bucks! Maybe You Tube is next step for me. I am retired.  So again Amazon Ain‚Äôt Your Friend, Pal!

Okay so my problem with amazon originally started as my fault, i put the wrong address. Instead of putting west I put east. On the day of the delivery the driver called me, I apologized and gave him the correct address, and he told me he would update the address and I would get it delivered the following day. Cool.So the following day I check my shipping address at 6 am, and it wasn't corrected. I did the chat thing and the chatter informed me that she added it to the delivery instructions. Skeptical, I called in and the lady on the phone confirmed with me I would receive the package today at the corrected address.A few hours go by and I receive a call from the driver that he was at the wrong address, yet again, and when I gave him the corrected address he said it was outside of his delivery zone.So I call in again and after a 30 minute phone call of just trying to update my address for the following day, the guy told me he updated the notes and address. Address was still incorrect and delivery notes were deleted and he put that I wanted my order the following day.So I then do the chat thing again and they inform me to replace the order and I would get a full refund, which would've worked but I had ordered the last item in stock. So I ask if I can update the address and they tell me no and ask if I want to speak to a specialist.I understand the mistake was originally my fault but it is a simple mistake and I was willing to wait a few days to accommodate that but they have no basic understanding of what I am asking for.

It is really easy to sale and purchase from Amazon and their Kindle is really sturdy and affordable for those who just love web browsing and online movie watching. Amazon seems to be slipping as to the reliability of the order dates. You know, the ones on the item detail page. For Example Prime member's, order is stated two days, sometimes three days. these order dates are always stated right on that page. But  following my last purchase, I received a notice that the item order date had been extended by two or three days. (So I canceled the purchase). And now I find that Prime Video has commercials... COMMERCIALS. Folks, I do not pay a monthly fee for commercials. I get enough of that with Directv. This was one reason I chose a prime membership. I do not pay a monthly fee to have my order date made LATE  by two or three days. The date on the item details page. (And I always take a screenshot of the page at the time of the purchase) should be the same price and date that the item is actually delivered. When I purchase items from Amazon, I often choose the item according to the order date and that price and order date should be honored by Amazon. If there are too many deliveries, hire more drivers. There are lots of people wanting jobs right now. Amazon needs to be a little bit more aware of their ‚Äúlittle details‚Äù, like the order dates. It is now time to purchase items for Christmas. My question is, can I depend on Amazon with delivering the items on time? Or are my gifts going to arrive in 2021.

I am giving Amazon three stars because I have had one positive and one negative interaction with Amazon customer support over many years. I ordered a settee from Amazon and was given a shipment date of Thursday.  All day Thursday Amazon showed that the settee was scheduled to arrive by 8 PM. It never arrived. I understood all of that, but on Friday the Amazon organization lost their credibility with me. On Friday, I received an email from Amazon saying they had a glitch and they would let me know when my item shipped and when it was expected to arrive. I read that to mean it could arrive in a week, six weeks, two months. I called customer support to get a more specific shipment date; they said they didn't know. I was told to call back next week to see if they had more information. They would give me no information as to why there was a delay in shipment. I have been a Prime member since the beginning and an Amazon customer long before that. I have never been left with such incompetent, open-ended information in my extended interaction with them. Perhaps they're getting too big for their boots.

Amazon uses third party sellers which may or may not honor refund request. Recently, I cancelled an expensive lighting fixture order, but the company sent it (after Amazon sent me a message saying the order was cancelled). I have been trying for almost two months to get a return label for a $500 item. Additionally, today, I received a NextBase 422GW car dash cam instead of a 622GW from a third party seller. This was a birthday gift for 9/22. My son helped me drive his birthday gift to an Amazon locker for return. The seller sent an old version at the new version price. And, last week, Amazon Warehouse delivered a microwave upside down with broken foam that was hugely dented inside and out for a small markdown. It looks like trash and cost $300 with tax. Now, I have to repackage this heavy item and bring it to UPS and go without a microwave, or reorder through Amazon (rewarding incompetence). Amazon has fine infrastructure (fast order, return lockers at third parity locations). It undoubtedly has greased some palms. Amazon has cut out its competitors, who now sell as third party vendors. Amazon is now careless. Yesterday, packages were thrown across my driveway to run over.

I placed an order on 06,01. I think I am just being fobbed off with random  excuses/explanations. This is ridiculous, makes no sense whatsoever and istotally unacceptable.This email also says: *We're sorry about the delay in getting your order to you, but I'm pleased to tell you that we're preparing it for dispatch now.**Within the next business day you should receive an e-mail from us confirming that the following items have been dispatched:*This ,too, is untrue as apparently they are still trying to locate the item and it has not been dispatched yet. But I do not want it  sent to me, I want it cancelled, as I have been saying since 13/01, and  my money refunded but according to their advisors this cannot be done until it has been dispatched.And apparently there is no way of getting this complaint escalated to a non existent complaint department as I a told the customer service is  also the complaint department . Resolver is not an option either as Amazon UK has decided not to accept complaints raised via Resolver.Absolutely disgusting customer serviceNEVER AGAIN
